<<<api>>>: BufferedReader.readLine()
<<<code>>>: 
First, you need to open the selected .txt file using a BufferedReader object. Then, you can use the readLine() method to read the content of the file line by line. Finally, you can set the content of the TextView using the setText() method.

Here's an example code snippet:

```java
File selected = new File(fileList.get(position));
if (selected.isFile()) {
    try {
        BufferedReader reader = new BufferedReader(new FileReader(selected));
        StringBuilder content = new StringBuilder();
        String line;
        while ((line = reader.readLine()) != null) {
            content.append(line);
            content.append("\n");
        }
        reader.close();
        TextView resultTextView = findViewById(R.id.result);
        resultTextView.setText(content.toString());
    } catch (IOException e) {
        e.printStackTrace();
    }
}
```

<<<explanation>>>: 
In this code, we first check if the selected file is a file (not a directory). Then, we create a BufferedReader object to read the content of the file. We use a StringBuilder to store the content line by line. The readLine() method reads each line of the file until it reaches the end (returns null). We append each line to the StringBuilder along with a newline character. After reading all the lines, we close the BufferedReader. Finally, we get a reference to the TextView with the ID "result" and set its text to the content of the file using the setText() method.
